Pre-Game Insights: A desperate Pakistan will take on a roaring South African team in Chennai’s MA Chidambaram Stadium.
Pakistan has suffered three consecutive losses, including an eight-wicket defeat to Afghanistan.
South Africa has emerged as one of the most commanding teams in the tournament with a massive 149-run win over Bangladesh.
The MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai has produced balanced wickets with an average score of 245.
Fast bowlers can generate some movement and bounce with the new ball, while spinners generally take wickets as the ball starts gripping.
Pakistan's batting has lacked consistency and failed to score runs at a quick rate.
Pakistan's bowling has seemed toothless with no player finding breakthroughs at regular intervals.
South Africa's batting has been a massive strength with players like Quinton de Kock, Heinrich Klaasen, and Aiden Markram scoring fluently.
South Africa's bowling has looked in great form, especially the pacers, who have regularly picked up wickets in the early stage of the innings.
Proteas captain Temba Bavuma and fast bowler Lungi Ngidi missed the previous game against Bangladesh due to injury.
